meanings.definition: Growing upright with branches parallel to the main stem.
meanings.sent1: The fastigiate trees in the forest stood tall and straight.
meanings.sent2: The fastigiate cypress trees lined the path in perfect symmetry.
meanings.sent3: The fastigiate trees seemed to be in a competition to see who could grow the tallest.
meanings.sent4: The fastigiate poplars reached for the sky like nature's skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The fastigiate pines created a striking silhouette against the sunset.

meanings.definition: Having a pointed or narrow top.
meanings.sent1: The fastigiate spire of the castle reached towards the clouds.
meanings.sent2: The fastigiate mountain peak was visible from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The fastigiate hat made him look like a walking exclamation mark.
meanings.sent4: Her fastigiate hairstyle made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The fastigiate tower of the church dominated the skyline.

meanings.definition: In architecture, having a pointed or narrow top.
meanings.sent1: The fastigiate arches of the cathedral added to its grandeur.
meanings.sent2: The fastigiate spires of the castle gave it a majestic appearance.
meanings.sent3: The fastigiate roof of the house made it look like a tiny castle.
meanings.sent4: The fastigiate columns of the building resembled ancient Greek temples.
meanings.sent5: The fastigiate windows of the church let in beams of sunlight.
